acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour EC50=0.01mg/L of Crustacea (Water flea) (HSDB, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was based on rat LD50 value of 374mg/kg (PIM(Poisons Information Monographs) 454, World Health Organization/IPCS, 2001).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The vapor pressure of this product is 0.0033Pa (20degC). Saturated vapor pressure pressures concentrations was calculated with 0.03ppm, and 0.102mg/L was 8.3ppm, it imagined it as mist. Based on rat LC50 value: 0.102mg/L/4h, 0.135mg/L/4h, 0.16mg/L/4h (all are PIM(Poisons Information Monographs) 454, WHO/IPCS, 2001), the category was carried out with calculation. LC50 = 0.105mg/L/4h.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 17 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: PIM(Poisons Information Monographs)454, WHO/IPCS (2001)

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it can be considered that there is no clear evidence of tumor formation in rat and mouse based on the description "Male Rats:Equivocal of HSDB (2004) (former literature is NTP TR16 and 1979), Female Rats:Equivocal, Male Mice:Negative, and Female Mice:Negative". So it was considered as the outside of Category .

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=0.79(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on its flash point; etc.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There are two or more positive reports from the data of RTECS(2004) and HSDB(2004) in the in vivo marrow chromosomal aberration test of a rat and a mouse, and it is negative in the chromosomal aberration test with a mouse spermatocyte. So it is set as Category 2.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Uses are agricultural chemicals, and even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite spontaneously.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Although in the laboratory-animals data (a teratogenicity study, 2generation reproduction study) of HSDB (2004) and Toxicology Data Review Summaries (California EPA/Dept.of Pesticide Regulation, 1990), decrease in fetus weight was seen,  but in PIM (Poisons Information Monographs) 454 (WHO/IPCS, 2001), there is the knowledge in the humans"pregnancy is continued without being influenced, and normal child was born", it was thought that there was no reproductive toxicity in humans, and it was considered as the outside of Category.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale:
There is the description about the human eye stimulativeness that "Most of the 32 persons felt the irritant property of the conjunctiva immediately after application"(PIM (Poisons Information Monographs) 454 (WHO/IPCS, 2001)). So we classified it as Category 2. However, the data was insufficient, so deliberate categorization of 2A and 2B was impossible.
[Indication] 2A is recommended based on the safety, when the Category needs to subdivide.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since the data was insufficient, we could not classify it.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: We classified it into Category 1 (nervous systems) based on the Priority 1-equivalent PIM (Poisons Information Monographs) 454 (WHO/IPCS, 2001) and the description about the possibility in human, "effect on the central nervous system" and"cholinesterase inhibitors: it has accumulation effect" of ICSC(1995) of Priority 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, respiratory system, cardiovascular system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system, respiratory system, cardiovascular system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1 (nervous system, respiratory system, cardio-vascular system) based on the report in humans, "the target organs are nervous system, respiratory system and cardio-vascular system"(PIM (Poisons Information Monographs) 454 (WHO/IPCS, 2001), which is equivalent to Priority 1).
